intro: Charybdis pancration, commonly known as the giant red spider lily, is a striking plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy red flowers with white markings. The plant features strap-like, dark green leaves that emerge from a bulbous underground stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Charybdis pancration is known for its ability to bloom in late summer, adding a dramatic touch to woodland gardens.
